      • write

        GrpcUniExchange<O,I> write(O data)
        Description copied from interface: GrpcWriteStream
        Write some data to the stream. The data is put on an internal write queue, and the write actually happens asynchronously. To avoid running out of memory by putting too much on the write queue, check the WriteStream.writeQueueFull() method before writing. This is done automatically if using a Pump.
        Specified by:
        write in interface GrpcWriteStream<O>
        Specified by:
        write in interface WriteStream<O>
        Parameters:
        data - the data to write
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • setWriteQueueMaxSize

        GrpcUniExchange<O,I> setWriteQueueMaxSize(int maxSize)
        Description copied from interface: GrpcWriteStream
        Set the maximum size of the write queue to maxSize. You will still be able to write to the stream even if there is more than maxSize items in the write queue. This is used as an indicator by classes such as Pump to provide flow control.

        The value is defined by the implementation of the stream, e.g in bytes for a NetSocket, the number of Message for a MessageProducer, etc...

        Specified by:
        setWriteQueueMaxSize in interface GrpcWriteStream<O>
        Specified by:
        setWriteQueueMaxSize in interface WriteStream<O>
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the max size of the write stream
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • drainHandler

        GrpcUniExchange<O,I> drainHandler(Handler<Void> handler)
        Description copied from interface: GrpcWriteStream
        Set a drain handler on the stream. If the write queue is full, then the handler will be called when the write queue is ready to accept buffers again. See Pump for an example of this being used.

        The stream implementation defines when the drain handler, for example it could be when the queue size has been reduced to maxSize / 2.

        Specified by:
        drainHandler in interface GrpcWriteStream<O>
        Specified by:
        drainHandler in interface WriteStream<O>
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler
        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • fail

        Description copied from interface: GrpcWriteStream
        Send an error event into the stream.
        Specified by:
        fail in interface GrpcWriteStream<O>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

      • writeObserver

        io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<O> writeObserver()
        Description copied from interface: GrpcWriteStream
        Should not be used by end user, it is a simple accessor the the underlying gRPC StreamObserver.
        Specified by:
        writeObserver in interface GrpcWriteStream<O>
        Returns:
        the underlying stream observer.
